overview: Daniel Foa has 12 years of experience in the China market in a wide range of environments, with particular expertise in new technology development and new media. Before founding his present company, FairKlima, Daniel held managerial positions in Business Operations departments of several major multinational firms; consulted in financial services; launched a Web 2.0 start-up; and led the internet strategy at the Shanghai Stock Exchange while at IBM. Daniel has spoken at a number of international events on China’s Internet Finance, Microfinance and Social entrepreneurship. Daniel was featured for 51Give’s Chinese sustainable microfinance projects in the UN Foundation’s film for the official UN TCKTCKTCK Copenhagen campaign, featured at the Cop15 UN conference. In December 2009, Daniel attended the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Copenhagen, Denmark to advocate for the role of Chinese youth in fighting environmental problems. Dan has successfully turned the concept of social entrepreneurship into a mainstream movement in China
